byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris.

abstract: Danish town decrees public day care centers and kindergartens must serve pork, continuing recent significant revisions to country's historically open immigration policies; supporters say move is effort to preserve Danish culture, while critics assert it is transparent attempt by rightists to needlessly and unfairly marginalize Muslims.

headline.print_headline: Mandatory Pork: Menu Rule in Denmark Opens New Front in Immigration Debate
headline.main: Denmark’s New Front in Debate Over Immigrants: Children’s Lunches

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Pork has become the latest weapon in a fight to preserve national identity after Randers, Denmark, voted to require day care centers and kindergartens to include it on menus.
lead_paragraph: Pork has become the latest weapon in a fight to preserve national identity after Randers, Denmark, voted to require day care centers and kindergartens to include it on menus.
